newsitem.title: USA: Santa Fe begins pfd convertible tender.
newsitem.headline: Santa Fe begins pfd convertible tender.

text.p: Santa Fe Energy Resources said on Tuesday that it has begun an offer to buy up to 4.5 million shares of its outstanding convertible preferred stock, 7 percent series with a par value of $0.01 per share, for $24.50 per preferred share net to the seller in cash.
If more than 4.5 million preferred convertible shares have been validly tendered, the company said it will buy on a pro rata basis and adjust its buys to avoid fractional shares.
Preferred shares not purchased will be returned to the stockholder at Santa Fe's expense, the company said.

The company said shareholders who tender shares retain rights to receive the regular quarterly dividend of $0.35 per preferred share to be paid December 1 to holders of record November 1. Preferred share buyers responding to the offer will not be entitled to any dividends, it said.
The company said its convertible preferred closed at yesterday at $23.375 per share.
Santa Fe said it believes the tender will help its proposed spin-off of its heavy oil and other operations in California.
The offer expires November 19, it said.
